definition[0]: if two things cancel each other out, they are equally important and have an opposite effect to each other, so that neither one has any effect
example[0]: The losses in our overseas division have cancelled out the profits made in the home market.
definition[1]: if one thing cancels out another, it has an equal but opposite effect, so that the effects of the first thing are not felt
example[1]: The losses in our overseas division have cancelled out this year’s profits.
